name: In Other Words! Online Quiz | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
for - team.

	The 'for' in this sentence means 'on behalf of' the school football team. The 'team' means a group of footballers who play together.

questions.text: Simon ______ the book with the ______ coloured cover.
questions.explanation:
read -  red.

	The first 'read' is the action of reading (in the past tense). The second 'red' is the colour.

questions.text: Lyndsey could ______ the flash of lightning before she ______ the thunder.
questions.explanation:
see - heard.

	'See' is the action of looking. 'Heard' means the action of hearing (in the past tense).

questions.text: David's mother gave him ______ medicine to ______ his tummy ache.
questions.explanation:
some - heal.

	The 'some' used in this sentence means an amount of medicine. The 'heal' means to make the tummy ache better.

questions.text: On the twins' birthday, Pauline used _____ to bake ______ cake.
questions.explanation:
flour - their.

	In this sentence 'flour' means the fine powder used to make cakes. The 'their' means the cake belongs to the twins.

questions.text:
______ Clair,
I am writing to let you ______ that I want to be your friend.
questions.explanation:
Dear - know.

	The 'dear' used in this sentence is an expression of friendship. The 'know' means 'make you aware'.

questions.text: Elizabeth  saw ______ dolphins swimming in the ______.
questions.explanation:
four - sea.

	The 'four' in this sentence means the number '4'. The 'sea' means an ocean or large area of water.

questions.text: The boys kicked ______ ball over ______ into the trees.
questions.explanation:
their - there.

	The first 'Their' in this sentence means the ball belongs to the boys. The other 'there' means the place or direction in which the ball was kicked.

questions.text: Amy and Kim both ______ with ______  ______ hand.
questions.explanation:
write - their - right.

	The first 'write' in this sentence means to draw words on paper. The 'their' means the hands belong to the girls. The second 'right' means the direction (opposite of left).

questions.text: It was ______ far for the ______ of us to walk.
questions.explanation:
too - two.

	The first 'too' in this sentence means it was a greater distance than they wanted to walk. The other 'two' is the number '2'.
